snippet: New York and other states with outdated election schedules should provide a two-week voting period instead of cramming it all into one day.
abstract: Editorial urges New York and other states with outdated election schedules to provide a two-week voting period instead of cramming it all into one day, contends voting should be easy, convenient and efficient, and getting rid of antiquated one-day voting would make an essential civic duty a lot easier to meet.
lead_paragraph: New York and other states with outdated election schedules should provide a two-week voting period instead of cramming it all into one day.
